name: UpdateAsanaStory
description:
Update an Asana story's details.

Use this tool to update the text of a comment story or pin/unpin comment and attachment stories in Asana. Only one of `text` or `html_text` can be updated at a time. Requires 'stories:write' permission.

parameters.name: story_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the Asana story to be updated.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the story.

parameters.name: asana_comment_story_update_data
parameters.description: JSON object containing details of the comment story to be updated, including `gid`, `resource_type`, and either `text` or `html_text`.

gid.description: Globally unique identifier of the resource, as a string.

resource_type.description: The base type of this resource.

created_at.description: The time at which this resource was created.

resource_subtype.description: The subtype of this resource. Different subtypes retain many of the same fields and behavior, but may render differently in Asana or represent resources with different semantic meaning.

text.description: The plain text of the comment to add. Cannot be used with html_text.

html_text.description: [Opt In](/docs/inputoutput-options). HTML formatted text for a comment. This will not include the name of the creator.

is_pinned.description: *Conditional*. Whether the story should be pinned on the resource.

sticker_name.description: The name of the sticker in this story. `null` if there is no sticker.

data.description: A story represents an activity associated with an object in the Asana system.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response. Defaults to excluding some properties.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for a readable, formatted response. Use for debugging as it increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: story_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the story.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the story.

gid.description: Globally unique identifier of the resource, as a string.

resource_type.description: The base type of this resource.

created_at.description: The time at which this resource was created.

resource_subtype.description: The subtype of this resource. Different subtypes retain many of the same fields and behavior, but may render differently in Asana or represent resources with different semantic meaning.

text.description: The plain text of the comment to add. Cannot be used with html_text.

html_text.description: [Opt In](/docs/inputoutput-options). HTML formatted text for a comment. This will not include the name of the creator.

is_pinned.description: *Conditional*. Whether the story should be pinned on the resource.

sticker_name.description: The name of the sticker in this story. `null` if there is no sticker.

data.description: A story represents an activity associated with an object in the Asana system.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
